elements.title: New Zealand shilling (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Māori warrior on the New Zealand shilling (pictured) was actually depicted wearing a dance uniform?

elements.title: Gogoliad (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that with Gogoliad, Dmitri Shostakovich ended his film career with Grigori Kozintsev, the same director with whom he started?

elements.title: Mongol campaigns in Siberia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that during the Mongol campaigns in Siberia, the Mongols defeated rival tribes at the Battle of Irtysh River?

elements.title: Asifa Lahore (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 2014, BBC Three cancelled a debate on being gay and Muslim featuring Asifa Lahore, a Muslim drag queen, citing security concerns at the mosque where it was filmed?

elements.title: Thy Strong Word (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that "Thy Strong Word" replaced an anti–Mexican–American War hymn in the Episcopal Church?

elements.title: Chuck Person's Eccojams Vol. 1 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that despite Daniel Lopatin's electronic album Chuck Person's Eccojams Vol. 1 having a limited 2010 release on cassette tapes, it became a foundational album for the vaporwave genre?

elements.title: Shanthi Kalathil (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Shanthi Kalathil believes Radio Free Asia "filled a critical role in combating Chinese disinformation"?

elements.title: a pornographic screenplay about Jesus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a pornographic screenplay about Jesus led to papal and royal condemnations, a firebombing, the writer's ban from the UK, and thousands of letters per week demanding the ban of a non-existent gay Jesus film?
